page.title: 04Notable Changes In Whitby.
page.content: The most recent change has been the opening of the{New Road Bridge,}by{The {Marquis of Normanby}in 1980.Traffic is now able to bypass the town centre.A controversial road junction at one end of the bridge is causing much local discussion.The town's old{swing bridge is being refurbished. The new{hospital}was opened in 1977 on the site of the old hospital.The rubble was used to build the new{ {yachting marina.}This marina changed the shape of the River Esk by creating a weir. A new{industrial estate} on the east side has opened up places for small industry.Whitby's first purpose built supermarket was opened by 'Hintons' in 1981.A new{reservoir,}built behind St. Hilda's Anglican School has now become operational. Four new{private housing {estates}have been built.
